title: Cherry Lies
subtitle: A Twin Peaks Mystery for Marlena's Bridal Shower
setting: The bridal shower takes place at a cozy venue reminiscent of the Double R Diner. The guests have gathered to celebrate Marlena, but beneath the cheerful atmosphere lies a tale of stolen recipes, false heritage claims, and deadly ambition.
overview: In a town where secrets hide behind warm smiles and cherry pie, someone has crossed a dangerous line. What began as recipe theft has ended in tragedy. When Cassandra, a food blogger investigating local culinary heritage, is found dead from a poisoned pie slice, guests must unravel the truth. Was it about money, pride, or protecting a carefully constructed lie?

theMurder.victimDescription: A food blogger and culinary researcher who was documenting authentic Twin Peaks recipes and family heritage stories for a feature article.
theMurder.timeOfDeath: Early morning, before the bridal shower began
theMurder.location: Outside Morgan's new artisan pie shop

theMurderer.motive: Cassandra discovered that Morgan stole Norma's secret cherry pie recipe and was passing it off as her own 'family heritage' to attract investors for her new pie business. When Cassandra threatened to publish the truth, Morgan's dreams of success—and the investor money already promised—would vanish.
theMurderer.method: Poisoned a slice of the stolen cherry pie recipe and gave it to Cassandra as a 'sample' to 'clear things up'
theMurderer.coverUp: Morgan is acting concerned about Cassandra's absence while secretly relieved the blogger won't expose her lies

solution: Morgan Blackwood stole Norma's cherished cherry pie recipe and claimed it as her own family heritage to secure investor funding for an artisan pie business. When food blogger Cassandra Vale found proof of the theft through secret photos and interviews, Morgan silenced her with a poisoned pie slice. The cupcake reveal exposes Morgan's guilt, and Norma's recipe is returned to its rightful owner.
hostNotes: This PG-13 mystery works for guests unfamiliar with Twin Peaks—the core conflict is universal (theft, lies, and consequences). The Log Lady's mystical warnings add flavor but aren't required knowledge. Time the final envelope opening to happen BEFORE the cupcake reveal so all players understand the solution before the dramatic presentation. If guests struggle, have the Log Lady deliver an extra prophecy.

intro.name: Arrival & First Warnings
intro.description: Guests arrive, receive character packets, and open Envelope 1. The Log Lady begins delivering cryptic warnings about theft and false heritage.

mid.name: Investigation Deepens
mid.description: Envelope 2 opened. Clues about recipe theft, secret photos, and investor meetings emerge. Players begin trading information.

pre-final.name: The Web Tightens
pre-final.description: Envelope 3 opened. Critical evidence surfaces: proof of theft, motive becomes clear, Morgan's desperation shows.

final.name: Truth Before Reveal
final.description: Envelope 4 opened. Final clues confirm Morgan's guilt. All players prepare for the cupcake reveal ceremony.

cupcakeReveal: A poisoned slice was the silence.
The phone text places her there.
